column2: Optical fiber is thin, flexible, transparent fiber made of pure glass.
Optical fiber is made of silica.
Optical fiber is a waveguide to transmit light between two ends of the fiber.
Optical fibers have less loss than metal wires.
Optical fibers are immune to electromagnetic interference.
Optical fiber is used for communication, remote sensors, illumination, imaging, endoscopes, and spectroscopy.
Optical fiber utilizes total internal reflection.

Optical fiber is made of three parts: the core, the thin glass center where light travels; the cladding, the outer material that reflects the light back into the core; and the buffer coating, which protects the fiber from damage and moisture.
Optical fibers come as single-mode and multi-mode.
Optical fibers can be made from plastic.
